page.title: 06A Vets Day (2)
page.content: After the test three more calls to see a calf with pneumonia,a goat with mastitis,and a cow with a lame foot before a call on the radiophone tells me to return to the surgery to see a sheep with a prolapsed cervix.An interview with a pharmaceutical co. rep. and the spaying of a cat precede my lunch of fish and chips. At two o'clock afternoon surgery is the usual mixture but phone calls soon summon me to two farms with calf scouring problems.Back for 5 o'clock surgery to find six people waiting with various pet problems including a cat with cancer which sadly has to be euthanised.Just as I think the days work is finished a call comes in at 7 o'clock to attend a calving.9pm is time to watch the news and eat supper before attending to my own animals hoping to finish at about 12.30 am.
